example.gpt4_src: Saya selalu minum kopi setiap pagi sebagai bagian dari rutinitas sehari-hari saya.
example.gpt4_tgt: I always drink coffee every morning as part of my everyday routine.

example.gpt4_src: Kucing itu berwarna hitam dan sangat lucu.
example.gpt4_tgt: The cat is black and very cute.
Comment: Doesn't show how 'hitam' is different from any other colour

example.gpt4_src: Tolong buatkan saya secangkir kopi.
example.gpt4_tgt: Please make me a cup of coffee.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'belikan' (buy), 'ambilkan' (grab), etc.

example.gpt4_src: Jantungku berdebar kencang saat menunggu hasil ujian.
example.gpt4_tgt: My heart was throbbing fast while waiting for the exam results.

example.gpt4_src: Dia belajar kungfu sejak kecil untuk melindungi dirinya.
example.gpt4_tgt: He has been learning kungfu since childhood to protect himself.
Comment: Although it shows 'kungfu' is martial arts, it doesn't show difference from 'karate' or any others

example.gpt4_src: Saya harus lembur malam ini untuk menyelesaikan proyek.
example.gpt4_tgt: I have to work overtime tonight to finish the project.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'hard' (EN part) or just 'kerja' (to work) (ID part)

example.gpt4_src: Bau sampah di tempat pembuangan itu sangat menjijikan.
example.gpt4_tgt: The smell of garbage at the dump is very disgusting.
Comment: Menjijikan' isn't typically used for smells; doesn't show difference from 'menyengat' (intense) or 'tajam' (sharp); dropping 'very' sounds more natural

example.gpt4_src: Polisi menanyai saksi untuk mendapatkan informasi lebih lanjut tentang kejadian tersebut.
example.gpt4_tgt: The police questioned the witness to gather more information about the incident.
Comment: Keterangan' is more natural/typical here than 'informasi'

example.gpt4_src: Penjelasan guru itu mudah dimengerti oleh semua siswa.
example.gpt4_tgt: The teacher's explanation was easily understood by all the students.

example.gpt4_src: Proyek ini dirancang untuk selesai dalam waktu enam bulan.
example.gpt4_tgt: This project is planned to be completed within six months.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'diharapkan' (hoped)

example.gpt4_src: Anak-anak itu bermain dengan mainan baru mereka di taman.
example.gpt4_tgt: The children are playing with their new toys in the park.

example.gpt4_src: Dia dikenal sebagai penyanyi yang sangat berbakat di seluruh negeri.
example.gpt4_tgt: She is known as a very talented singer throughout the country.

example.gpt4_src: Tolong iris bawang merah ini tipis-tipis untuk salad.
example.gpt4_tgt: Please slice this red onion thinly for the salad.

example.gpt4_src: Setelah kecelakaan itu, dia menjalani program rehabilitasi selama enam bulan.
example.gpt4_tgt: After the accident, he underwent a six-month rehabilitation program.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'diet' or 'penyembuhan' (recovery)

example.gpt4_src: Saudari saya bekerja sebagai dokter di rumah sakit.
example.gpt4_tgt: My sister works as a doctor at the hospital.
Comment: Unclear that 'saudari' is female; 'saudari' has a more general meaning than 'sister

example.gpt4_src: Luka di tangannya berdarah setelah terjatuh dari sepeda.
example.gpt4_tgt: The wound on his hand was bleeding after he fell off his bike.

example.gpt4_src: Kami mendaki gunung setiap akhir pekan untuk menikmati pemandangan.
example.gpt4_tgt: We hike the mountain every weekend to enjoy the view.

example.gpt4_src: Mereka harus bernegosiasi dengan pihak lain untuk mencapai kesepakatan.
example.gpt4_tgt: They have to negotiate with the other party to reach an agreement.

example.gpt4_src: Kami berfoto di depan candi Borobudur saat liburan.
example.gpt4_tgt: We took a photo in front of the Borobudur temple during our vacation.

example.gpt4_src: Kebajikan adalah salah satu nilai yang diajarkan oleh orang tua kepada anak-anak mereka.
example.gpt4_tgt: Virtue is one of the values taught by parents to their children.
Comment: Unclear what 'virtue' is

example.gpt4_src: Guru itu menuntun murid-muridnya dengan sabar.
example.gpt4_tgt: The teacher guides her students patiently.
Comment: Doesn't show the difference from 'mengajar' (EN: teach)

example.gpt4_src: Dia merasakan duka yang mendalam setelah kehilangan ibunya.
example.gpt4_tgt: He felt deep grief after losing his mother.

example.gpt4_src: Dia disalahkan atas kesalahan yang sebenarnya tidak dia lakukan.
example.gpt4_tgt: He was blamed for a mistake he didn't actually make.
Comment: Although the context of mistake is mentioned, it's still unclear that 'disalahkan' is about attribution of fault

example.gpt4_src: Status pekerjaan saya saat ini adalah manajer proyek.
example.gpt4_tgt: My current job status is project manager.
Comment: I expect something like 'honorer' (EN: non-continuing?) for a status of job rather than the occupation itself

example.gpt4_src: Saya menabung sebagian dari gaji saya setiap bulan untuk tabungan masa depan.
example.gpt4_tgt: I save a portion of my salary every month for future savings.
Comment: Using the verb form of the target word

example.gpt4_src: Kami duduk di depan perapian sambil menikmati secangkir teh hangat.
example.gpt4_tgt: We sat in front of the fireplace while enjoying a cup of warm tea.
Comment: Unclear what a fireplace is

example.gpt4_src: Meriam itu ditempatkan di atas bukit untuk melindungi kota dari serangan musuh.
example.gpt4_tgt: The cannon was placed on the hill to protect the city from enemy attacks.
Comment: Cannons are normally used to attack rather than defend

example.gpt4_src: Kelihatannya dia tidak akan datang ke pesta malam ini.
example.gpt4_tgt: Apparently, he is not coming to the party tonight.
Comment: Unclear that 'kelihatannya' is about inferring something from observations

example.gpt4_src: Biarkan dia pergi jika itu yang dia inginkan.
example.gpt4_tgt: Let him go if that's what he wants.
Comment: Although what the person wants is mentioned, it's still unclear that 'biarkan' has something to do with permission

example.gpt4_src: Harga mobil itu sangat mahal.
example.gpt4_tgt: The price of that car is very expensive.
Comment: Although price is mentioned, it's still unclear that 'mahal' is about the price being too high

example.gpt4_src: Kekhawatiran tentang perubahan iklim semakin meningkat di seluruh dunia.
example.gpt4_tgt: Concern about climate change is increasing around the world.
Comment: Iklim'/'climate' may be a difficult word for Indonesian/English learners respectively

example.gpt4_src: Apakah kamu tahu di mana letak perpustakaan?
example.gpt4_tgt: Do you know where the library is?
Comment: Letak' is odd here; I'd change 'letak perpustakaan' to 'perpustakaan berada' (EN: library is located)

example.gpt4_src: Kita akan pergi ke pantai lusa.
example.gpt4_tgt: We will go to the beach the day after tomorrow.
Comment: Unclear 'lusa' is about time rather than someting else like the beach's name

example.gpt4_src: Dia adalah anak tertua di keluarganya.
example.gpt4_tgt: He is the oldest child in his family.
Comment: Unclear 'tertua' is about age

example.gpt4_src: Mereka berencana mendirikan sebuah sekolah baru di desa itu tahun depan.
example.gpt4_tgt: They plan to establish a new school in the village next year.

example.gpt4_src: Pertunjukan kembang api tadi malam benar-benar dahsyat!
example.gpt4_tgt: The fireworks show last night was truly awesome!
Comment: Unclear that 'dahsyat' is something positive

example.gpt4_src: Ayam goreng ini sangat renyah dan lezat.
example.gpt4_tgt: This fried chicken is very crispy and delicious.

example.gpt4_src: Aku sangat merindukan keluargaku yang tinggal di luar negeri.
example.gpt4_tgt: I really miss my family who live abroad.

example.gpt4_src: Keluarga besar berkumpul untuk menghadiri pemakaman nenek mereka.
example.gpt4_tgt: The extended family gathered to attend their grandmother's funeral.
Comment: Unclear that 'pemakaman' is about someone's death

example.gpt4_src: Anjing itu menggonggong sepanjang malam.
example.gpt4_tgt: The dog barked all night long.
Comment: Unclear what specific activity 'menggonggong' is

example.gpt4_src: Dia menulis surat dengan tangan kanan.
example.gpt4_tgt: He writes the letter with his right hand.

example.gpt4_src: Banyak orang percaya bahwa surga adalah tempat yang penuh kedamaian dan kebahagiaan.
example.gpt4_tgt: Many people believe that heaven is a place full of peace and happiness.

example.gpt4_src: Dia tidak masuk kerja hari ini karena terkena flu.
example.gpt4_tgt: He didn't come to work today because he caught the flu.
Comment: Lack specific descriptions of flu; currently 'flu' can be replaced with 'cacar' (EN: chickenpox) and it still works

example.gpt4_src: Setelah bekerja keras sepanjang hari, tubuhnya mulai melemah.
example.gpt4_tgt: After working hard all day, his body began to weaken.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'lelah' (EN: tired)

example.gpt4_src: Kita harus selalu menghormati orang tua kita.
example.gpt4_tgt: We should always honor our parents.
Comment: Respect' seems more appropriate; doesn't show difference from 'mendoakan' (EN: pray for), 'mematuhi' (EN: obey), etc.

example.gpt4_src: Banyak kota-kota di Indonesia yang memiliki sejarah yang kaya dan budaya yang beragam.
example.gpt4_tgt: Many cities in Indonesia have a rich history and diverse cultures.
Comment: Unclear that 'kota' is related to regions and levels of government

example.gpt4_src: Setelah kehilangan pekerjaannya, Budi mengalami depresi yang mendalam.
example.gpt4_tgt: After losing his job, Budi experienced deep depression.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'kesedihan' (EN: sadness), 'kekecewaan' (EN: disappointment), etc

example.gpt4_src: Dia memakai topi merah saat pergi ke pasar.
example.gpt4_tgt: She wore a red hat when she went to the market.
Comment: Unclear that 'topi' is an accessory on one's head

example.gpt4_src: Anak-anak bermain di taman setiap sore.
example.gpt4_tgt: The children play in the park every afternoon.

example.gpt4_src: Acara tersebut mendatangkan banyak wisatawan dari berbagai negara.
example.gpt4_tgt: The event brought many tourists from various countries.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'mengundang' (EN: to invite)
